str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From noieo; a perception, i.e. Purpose, or the intellect, disposition, itself.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To harden, render callous, petrify. Apparently from poros; to petrify, i.e. to indurate.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A covering, especially a covering of head and face, a veil. From kalupto; a cover, i.e. Veil.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Recognition, reading; public reading (of the law and prophets in synagogue or church). From anaginosko; reading.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Old, ancient, not new or recent. From palai; antique, i.e. Not recent, worn out.
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To unveil, uncover. From ana and kalupto; to unveil.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
